member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BitmapRenderer
member.summary: Provides methods for drawing on a .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BitmapRenderer.Bitmap
member.summary: Gets the target bitmap.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BitmapRenderer.UpdatedPixelMask
member.summary: Gets or sets a that can be used to monitor changes in the target bitmap. Its pixels are used as boolean flags indicating changes in the target. When a pixel in the target bitmap is changed, the corresponding pixel in this bitmap is set to 1 (true). The must have the same pixel size as the target bitmap. It is user's responsibility to clear this bitmap (fill it with zeros) before any drawing on the target occurs.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BitmapRenderer.BackgroundBitmap
member.summary:
Gets or sets a bitmap providing background for all drawing and filling operations.
The same bitmap cannot be used as background and target at the same time.
The background bitmap must be of the same pixel size as the target bitmap.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BitmapRenderer.BackgroundBitmapContainsUnmodifiedImage
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating that copying pixels from the to the target bitmap should not be marked as changed in the .
The default is , indicating that pixels copied from the background bitmap to the target are marked as changed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BitmapRenderer.TransparencyMaskBitmap
member.summary:
Gets or sets a grayscale bitmap providing transparency mask for all drawing and filling operations.
Pixels in the mask with value 0 are fully opaque and will completely mask any drawing (i.e. the pixels of the target bitmap will remain unchanged). Pixels in the mask with value 255 are fully transparent, i.e. any drawing will have the same effect as if there was no mask. Pixels with values between 0 and 255 will modify the transparency of the pixels being drawn according to their value.
Note that the transparency mask bitmap must be of the same pixel size as the target bitmap.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BitmapRenderer.BlendMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the method of mixing source and destination colors when drawing.
Default is .

member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling mode to use when drawing bitmaps with resizing.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode
member.summary: Specifies the Porter Duff compositing method in which two pixels (source and destination) may contribute to the final color of the pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Clear
member.summary: No regions are enabled.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Copy
member.summary: Only the source will be present.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.BoundedCopy
member.summary: The source is copied to the destination, excluding the transparent pixels.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Destination
member.summary: Only the destination will be present.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceOver
member.summary: Source is placed over the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationOver
member.summary: Destination is placed over the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceIn
member.summary: The source that overlaps the destination, replaces the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationIn
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source, replaces the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceOut
member.summary: Source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationOut
member.summary: Destination is placed, where it falls outside of the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceAtop
member.summary: Source which overlaps the destination, replaces the destination. Destination is placed elsewhere.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source replaces the source. Source is placed elsewhere.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.XOR
member.summary: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Lighter
member.summary: Display the sum of the source image and destination image.

member.summary: Frankie Sierra's dithering algorithm (sometimes called Sierra-3).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.TwoRowSierra
member.summary: Simplified two-row Sierra algorithm.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.SierraLite
member.summary: Sierra Lite dithering.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod
member.summary: Indicates the way in which the GIF frame has to be treated after being displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.NotSpecified
member.summary: No disposal specified. The decoder is not required to take any action.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.DoNotDispose
member.summary: Do not dispose. The graphic is to be left in place.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.RestoreToBackgroundColor
member.summary: Restore to background color. The area used by the graphic must be restored to the background color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.RestoreToPrevious
member.summary: Restore to previous. The decoder is required to restore the area overwritten by the graphic with what was there prior to rendering the graphic.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard.BT709

member.summary: 1-bit indexed image with color palette.

member.summary: 4-bit indexed image with color palette.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.IcoFrameEncoding.Indexed8
member.summary: 8-bit indexed image with color palette.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.IcoFrameEncoding.Rgb15
member.summary: RGB image with 5 bits per channel, no color palette.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Specifies the sampling or filtering mode to use when scaling an image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: A nearest neighbor interpolation algorithm. Also known as nearest pixel or point interpolation.
member.remarks: The output pixel is assigned the value of the pixel that the point falls within. No other pixels are considered.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Linear
member.summary: A bilinear interpolation algorithm.
member.remarks: The output pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest four pixels in a 2x2 grid. For downscaling by factors greater than 2 use the Downscale interpolation mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Cubic
member.summary: A bicubic interpolation algorithm.
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest sixteen pixels in a 4x4 grid. For downscaling by factors greater than 2 use the Downscale interpolation mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Downscale
member.summary: A resampling algorithm for downscaling by factors greater than 2.
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the all the pixels that map to the new pixel.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode
member.summary: Specifies the different methods by which two regions can be combined.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Union
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the union of both.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Intersect
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking their intersection.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Xor
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the area that exists in the first region but not the second and the area that exists in the second region but not the first.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Exclude
member.summary: The second region is excluded from the first.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression
member.summary: Compression scheme used for encoding TIFF image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.DontCare
member.summary: Indicates a suitable compression algorithm based on the image and pixel format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.NoCompression
member.summary: No compression, but pack data into bytes as tightly as possible, leaving no unused bits (except at the end of a row).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.CCITT_1D
member.summary: CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run length encoding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Group_3_Fax
member.summary: T4-encoding: CCITT T.4 bi-level encoding as specified in section 4, Coding, of CCITT Recommendation T.4: Standardization of Group 3 Facsimile apparatus for document transmission.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Group_4_Fax
member.summary: T6-encoding: CCITT T.6 bi-level encoding as specified in section 2 of CCITT Recommendation T.6: Facsimile coding schemes and coding control functions for Group 4 facsimile apparatus.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.LZW
member.summary: An adaptive compression scheme for raster images.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Deflate
member.summary: Deflate compression, using zlib data format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.PackBits
member.summary: A simple byte-oriented runlength scheme.

member.summary: The orientation of the image.

member.summary: Normal horizontal (default).

member.summary: Mirror horizontal.

member.summary: Rotate 90 degrees clockwise.

member.summary: Mirror horizontal and rotate 90 degrees clockwise.

member.summary: Specifies whether an image can be loaded from TIFF frame and the reason if it can't.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.Success
member.summary: No problems found. Image can be loaded from a .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.IncompatibleCompressionScheme
member.summary: CCITT_1D, Group_3_Fax, and Group_4_Fax compression schemes are only supported for SamplesPerPixel = 1 and BitsPerSample = 1.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.MissingColorMap
member.summary: ColorMap is a required field for the RGB_Palette color space.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.MoreThanOneSamplePerPixel
member.summary: The specified color space (WhiteIsZero, BlackIsZero, TransparencyMask, or RGB_Palette) supports only one component (sample) per pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.NoStripOffsetsOrByteCounts
member.summary: StripOffsets or StripByteCounts fields are missing (while TileWidth and TileLength are not defined).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.NoTileOffsetsOrByteCounts
member.summary: TileOffsets or TileByteCounts fields are missing for a tiled TIFF frame.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.TileWidthIsNotMultipleOf16
member.summary: TileWidth must be a multiple of 16 (or at least of 8 for ).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnexpectedBitsPerSample
member.summary: Unexpected value of the BitsPerSample field.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnexpectedExtraSamples
member.summary: Unexpected value of the ExtraSamples field. supports single associated or unassociated alpha component.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedCompressionScheme
member.summary: TIFF frame's compression scheme is not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedDifferencingPredictor
member.summary: Differencing Predictor is supported for LZW and Deflate TIFF encoding schemes only.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedFillOrder
member.summary: FillOrder = 2 is only supported for SamplesPerPixel = 1 and BitsPerSample = 1.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedIndexedFormat
member.summary: Indexed images with BitsPerSample other than 4 or 8 are not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedPhotometricInterpretation
member.summary: The specified color space of the image data is not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedRGBFormat
member.summary: RGB images with SamplesPerPixel other than 3 or 4 are not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.ZeroSizedFrameTile
member.summary: Either TileWidth or TileLength are equal to zero for a tiled TIFF frame.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.ZeroSizedTiffFrame
member.summary: TIFF frame has either width or length equal to zero.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType
member.summary: Data types used in Exif.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Byte
member.summary: An 8-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Ascii
member.summary: An 8-bit byte containing one 7-bit ASCII code. The final byte is terminated with NULL.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Short
member.summary: A 16-bit (2-byte) unsigned integer.

member.summary: A 32-bit (4-byte) unsigned integer.

member.summary: Two LONGs. The first LONG is the numerator and the second LONG expresses the denominator.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SByte
member.summary: An 8-bit signed (twos-complement) integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Undefined
member.summary: An 8-bit byte that may take any value depending on the field definition.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SShort
member.summary: A 16-bit (2-byte) signed (twos-complement) integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SLong
member.summary: (4-byte) signed integer (2's complement notation).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SRational
member.summary: Two SLONGs. The first SLONG is the numerator and the second SLONG is the denominator.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Float
member.summary: Single precision (4-byte) IEEE format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Double
member.summary: Double precision (8-byte) IEEE format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.IFD
member.summary: Identical to LONG, but is only used to point to other valid IFDs.

member.summary: The kind of light source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Flash
member.summary: Indicates the status of flash when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalLength
member.summary: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubjectArea
member.summary: Indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.MakerNote
member.summary: Manufacturer specific information.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.UserComment
member.summary: Keywords or comments on the image; complements ImageDescription.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubsecTime
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTime tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubsecTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeOriginal tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubsecTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Temperature
member.summary: Temperature as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room temperature where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is C.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Humidity
member.summary: Humidity as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room humidity where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is %.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Pressure
member.summary: Pressure as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room atmospfere where the photographer was holding the camera or the water pressure under the sea. The unit is hPa.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.WaterDepth
member.summary: Water depth as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the water depth of the camera at underwater photography. The unit is m.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Acceleration
member.summary: Acceleration (a scalar regardless of direction) as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the driving acceleration of the vehicle which the photographer rode on at the shot. The unit is mGal (10-5 m/s2).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.CameraElevationAngle
member.summary: Elevation/depression. Angle of the orientation of the camera (imaging optical axis) as the ambient situation at the shot. The unit is degree().

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FlashpixVersion
member.summary: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.ColorSpace
member.summary: The color space information tag is always recorded as the color space specifier.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.PixelXDimension
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid width of the meaningful image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.PixelYDimension
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid height of the meaningful image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.RelatedSoundFile
member.summary: Used to record the name of an audio file related to the image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FlashEnergy
member.summary: Indicates the strobe energy at the time the image is captured, as measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SpatialFrequencyResponse
member.summary: Records the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalPlaneXResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image width (X) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalPlaneYResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image height (Y) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Indicates the unit for measuring FocalPlaneXResolution and FocalPlaneYResolution.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubjectLocation
member.summary: Indicates the location of the main subject in the scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.ExposureIndex
member.summary: Indicates the exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image is captured.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SensingMethod
member.summary: Indicates the image sensor type on the camera or input device.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FileSource
member.summary: Indicates the image source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SceneType
member.summary: Indicates the type of scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.CFAPattern
member.summary: Indicates the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used.

member.summary: Indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output.

member.summary: Indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot.

member.summary: Indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot.

member.summary: Indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot.

member.summary: Indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm.

member.summary: Indicates the type of scene that was shot.

member.summary: Indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment.

member.summary: Indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.summary: Indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Sharpness
member.summary: Indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.DeviceSettingDescription
member.summary: This tag indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model.

member.summary: Indicates the distance to the subject.

member.summary: Indicates an identifier assigned uniquely to each image.

member.summary: This tag records the owner of a camera used in photography.

member.summary: This tag records the serial number of the body of the camera that was used in photography.

member.summary: This tag notes minimum focal length, maximum focal length, minimum F number in the minimum focal length, and minimum F number in the maximum focal length, which are specification information for the lens that was used in photography.

member.summary: This tag records the lens manufacturer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.LensModel
member.summary: This tag records the lenss model name and model number.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.LensSerialNumber
member.summary: This tag records the serial number of the interchangeable lens that was used in photography.

member.summary: Indicates the value of coefficient gamma.

member.summary: Indicates the version of GPSInfoIFD.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag
member.summary: Exif tags that follow the TIFF structure.

member.summary: The number of columns in the image, i.e., the number of pixels per row.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.ImageLength
member.summary: The number of rows of pixels in the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Number of bits per component.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.Compression
member.summary: Compression scheme used on the image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.PhotometricInterpretation
member.summary: The color space of the image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.ImageDescription
member.summary: A string that describes the subject of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.Make
member.summary: The scanner manufacturer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.Model
member.summary: The scanner model name or number.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.StripOffsets
member.summary: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.Orientation
member.summary: The orientation of the image with respect to the rows and columns.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.SamplesPerPixel
member.summary: The number of components per pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.RowsPerStrip
member.summary: The number of rows per strip.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.StripByteCounts
member.summary: For each strip, the number of bytes in the strip after compression.

member.summary: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageWidth direction.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.YResolution
member.summary: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageLength direction.

member.summary: How the components of each pixel are stored.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.ResolutionUnit
member.summary: The unit of measurement for XResolution and YResolution.

member.summary: Describes a transfer function for the image in tabular style.

member.summary: Name and version number of the software package(s) used to create the image.

member.summary: Date and time of image creation.

member.summary: Person who created the image.

member.summary: The chromaticities of the primaries of the image.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag
member.summary: A set of tags for recording Exif-specific attribute information.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ExposureTime
member.summary: Exposure time, given in seconds.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FNumber
member.summary: The F number.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ExposureProgram
member.summary: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SpectralSensitivity
member.summary: Indicates the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.PhotographicSensitivity
member.summary: Indicates the ISO Speed and ISO Latitude of the camera or input device as specified in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.OECF
member.summary: Indicates the Opto-Electric Conversion Function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SensitivityType
member.summary: The SensitivityType tag indicates which one of the parameters of ISO12232 is the PhotographicSensitivity tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.StandardOutputSensitivity
member.summary: This tag indicates the standard output sensitivity value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.RecommendedExposureIndex
member.summary: This tag indicates the recommended exposure index value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ISOSpeed
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ISOSpeedLatitudeyyy
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude yyy value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ISOSpeedLatitudezzz
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude zzz value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ExifVersion
member.summary: The version of the supported Exif standard.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.DateTimeOriginal
member.summary: The date and time when the original image data was generated.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.DateTimeDigitized
member.summary: The date and time when the image was stored as digital data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.OffsetTime
member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTime tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.OffsetTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTimeOriginal tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.OffsetTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ComponentsConfiguration
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; specifies the channels and complements PhotometricInterpretation.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.CompressedBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; states the compressed bits per pixel.

member.summary: Shutter speed. The unit is the APEX (Additive System of Photographic Exposure) setting.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ApertureValue
member.summary: The lens aperture.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.BrightnessValue
member.summary: The value of brightness.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ExposureBiasValue
member.summary: The exposure bias.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.MaxApertureValue
member.summary: The smallest F number of the lens.

member.summary: The distance to the subject, given in meters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.MeteringMode
member.summary: The metering mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.LightSource
member.summary: The kind of light source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Flash
member.summary: Indicates the status of flash when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FocalLength
member.summary: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SubjectArea
member.summary: Indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.MakerNote
member.summary: Manufacturer specific information.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.UserComment
member.summary: Keywords or comments on the image; complements ImageDescription.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SubsecTime
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTime tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SubsecTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeOriginal tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SubsecTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Temperature
member.summary: Temperature as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room temperature where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is C.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Humidity
member.summary: Humidity as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room humidity where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is %.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Pressure
member.summary: Pressure as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room atmospfere where the photographer was holding the camera or the water pressure under the sea. The unit is hPa.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.WaterDepth
member.summary: Water depth as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the water depth of the camera at underwater photography. The unit is m.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Acceleration
member.summary: Acceleration (a scalar regardless of direction) as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the driving acceleration of the vehicle which the photographer rode on at the shot. The unit is mGal (10-5 m/s2).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.CameraElevationAngle
member.summary: Elevation/depression. Angle of the orientation of the camera (imaging optical axis) as the ambient situation at the shot. The unit is degree().

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FlashpixVersion
member.summary: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ColorSpace
member.summary: The color space information tag is always recorded as the color space specifier.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.PixelXDimension
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid width of the meaningful image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.PixelYDimension
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid height of the meaningful image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.RelatedSoundFile
member.summary: Used to record the name of an audio file related to the image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.InteroperabilityIFD
member.summary: Interoperability tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FlashEnergy
member.summary: Indicates the strobe energy at the time the image is captured, as measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SpatialFrequencyResponse
member.summary: Records the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FocalPlaneXResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image width (X) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FocalPlaneYResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image height (Y) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Indicates the unit for measuring FocalPlaneXResolution and FocalPlaneYResolution.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SubjectLocation
member.summary: Indicates the location of the main subject in the scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ExposureIndex
member.summary: Indicates the exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image is captured.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SensingMethod
member.summary: Indicates the image sensor type on the camera or input device.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.FileSource
member.summary: Indicates the image source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.SceneType
member.summary: Indicates the type of scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.CFAPattern
member.summary: Indicates the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.CustomRendered
member.summary: Indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ExposureMode
member.summary: Indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class and creates the image.
The image content is not initialized and can contain any random data.
If subsequent rendering is going to cover the whole surface of the bitmap, or if will be called on the bitmap with a non-null background color, clearing it (which is a lengthy operation for large bitmaps) is not needed. If some areas of the bitmap are going to be left untouched, they must be cleared to avoid the possibility of random artifacts showing.
member.param: The width of the image, in pixels.
The height of the image, in pixels.
Indicates whether the alpha channel should be ignored.
The horizontal dpi of the image.
The vertical dpi of the image.
Indicates whether pixel data should be dynamically mapped to a temporary file rather than kept fully in memory.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.StoreInTempFile
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether pixel data should be dynamically mapped to a temporary file rather than kept fully in memory.
Setting this property to frees up memory but slows down operations on pixel data.
Do not activate this mode for small images (less than 100 x 100 pixels).
The default is .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.Premultiplied
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if the color channels for all pixels are premultiplied by the alpha channel.
Setting this property doesn't perform actual conversion.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.Opaque
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the alpha channel of the image should be ignored.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.CreateImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Creates the image of the given size and resolution.
The content is not initialized and can contain any random data.
If subsequent rendering is going to cover the whole surface of the bitmap, or if will be called on the bitmap with a non-null background color, clearing it (which is a lengthy operation for large bitmaps) is not needed. If some areas of the bitmap are going to be left untouched, they must be cleared to avoid the possibility of random artifacts showing.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.ToGrayscaleBitmap(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a from the current .
This method does not perform any transformations of the color palette. It is expected that the source has already been converted to grayscale palette using a or something like that. Alternatively, you can use this method to extract individual channels of a color image without any prior conversion, and treat the resulting simply as a representation of some image data with 8 bits per pixel. The method just copies data from a specified color channel to a new instance of the class. If you need to copy some color channel to an existing instance of , use the method instead.
member.param: The color channel used as the source of grayscale data.
If true, indicates that 0 represents white and 255 represents black in the resulting .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcGifWriter.GlobalPalette
member.summary:
Gets or sets the palette with opaque colors in 32-bit ARGB format to be stored as the Global Color Table.
If the palette contains 255 or less elements, the transparent color can be appended to the Global Color Table.
Elements with index 256 and above are ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcGifWriter.IccProfileData
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw ICC profile data for the frames. The value should be assigned before appending the first frame.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcGifWriter.AllowAddingTransparentColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if a transparent color should be added to the Global and Local Color Tables, if the number of opaque colors is less than 256.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifFrame.UserInput
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether or not user input is expected before continuing.
When a is not 0 and the flag is set, processing will continue when user input is received or when the delay time expires, whichever occurs first.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.ChannelDefinitionMapper.getCompData(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlk,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns, in the blk argument, a block of image data containing the specifed rectangular area, in the specified component. The data is returned, as a copy of the internal data, therefore the returned data can be modified "in place".
The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' of the returned data is 0, and the 'scanw' is the same as the block's width. See the 'DataBlk' class.
If the data array in 'blk' is 'null', then a new one is created. If the data array is not 'null' then it is reused, and it must be large enough to contain the block's data. Otherwise an 'ArrayStoreException' or an 'IndexOutOfBoundsException' is thrown by the Java system.
The returned data has its 'progressive' attribute set to that of the input data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return. If it contains a non-null data array, then it must have the correct dimensions. If it contains a null data array a new one is created. The fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data. Only 0 and 3 are valid.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.ChannelDefinitionMapper.getInternCompData(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlk,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns, in the blk argument, a block of image data containing the specifed rectangular area, in the specified component. The data is returned, as a copy of the internal data, therefore the returned data can be modified "in place".
The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' of the returned data is 0, and the 'scanw' is the same as the block's width. See the 'DataBlk' class.
This method, in general, is less efficient than the 'getInternCompData()' method since, in general, it copies the data. However if the array of returned data is to be modified by the caller then this method is preferable.
If the data array in 'blk' is 'null', then a new one is created. If the data array is not 'null' then it is reused, and it must be large enough to contain the block's data. Otherwise an 'ArrayStoreException' or an 'IndexOutOfBoundsException' is thrown by the Java system.
The returned data may have its 'progressive' attribute set. In this case the returned data is only an approximation of the "final" data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return, relative to the current tile. If it contains a non-null data array, then it must be large enough. If it contains a null data array a new one is created. Some fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.ChannelDefinitionMapper.getFixedPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of bits, referred to as the "range bits", corresponding to the nominal range of the data in the specified component. If this number is b then for unsigned data the nominal range is between 0 and 2^b-1, and for signed data it is between -2^(b-1) and 2^(b-1)-1. For floating point data this value is not applicable.
member.returns: The number of bits corresponding to the nominal range of the data. Fro floating-point data this value is not applicable and the return value is undefined.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.ColorSpaceMapper
member.summary: This is the base class for all modules in the ucar.jpeg.colorspace and ucar.jpeg.icc profiling steps of the decoding chain. It is responsible for the allocation and iniitialization of all working storage. It provides several utilities which are of generic use in preparing DataBlks for use and provides default implementations for the getCompData and getInternCompData methods.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.ColorSpaceMapper.getParameterInfo
member.summary: Returns the parameters that are used in this class and implementing classes. It returns a 2D String array. Each of the 1D arrays is for a different option, and they have 3 elements. The first element is the option name, the second one is the synopsis and the third one is a long description of what the parameter is. The synopsis or description may be 'null', in which case it is assumed that there is no synopsis or description of the option, respectively. Null may be returned if no options are supported.
member.returns: the options name, their synopsis and their explanation, or null if no options are supported.

member.summary: Returns the number of bits, referred to as the "range bits", corresponding to the nominal range of the data in the specified component. If this number is b then for unsigned data the nominal range is between 0 and 2^b-1, and for signed data it is between -2^(b-1) and 2^(b-1)-1. For floating point data this value is not applicable.
member.returns: The number of bits corresponding to the nominal range of the data. Fro floating-point data this value is not applicable and the return value is undefined.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.ColorSpaceMapper.getCompData(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlk,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns, in the blk argument, a block of image data containing the specifed rectangular area, in the specified component. The data is returned, as a copy of the internal data, therefore the returned data can be modified "in place".
The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' of the returned data is 0, and the 'scanw' is the same as the block's width. See the 'DataBlk' class.
This method, in general, is less efficient than the 'getInternCompData()' method since, in general, it copies the data. However if the array of returned data is to be modified by the caller then this method is preferable.
If the data array in 'blk' is 'null', then a new one is created. If the data array is not 'null' then it is reused, and it must be large enough to contain the block's data. Otherwise an 'ArrayStoreException' or an 'IndexOutOfBoundsException' is thrown by the Java system.
The returned data may have its 'progressive' attribute set. In this case the returned data is only an approximation of the "final" data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return, relative to the current tile. If it contains a non-null data array, then it must be large enough. If it contains a null data array a new one is created. Some fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.ColorSpaceMapper.getInternCompData(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlk,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns, in the blk argument, a block of image data containing the specifed rectangular area, in the specified component. The data is returned, as a reference to the internal data, if any, instead of as a copy, therefore the returned data should not be modified.
The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' and 'scanw' of the returned data can be arbitrary. See the 'DataBlk' class.
This method, in general, is more efficient than the 'getCompData()' method since it may not copy the data. However if the array of returned data is to be modified by the caller then the other method is probably preferable.
If possible, the data in the returned 'DataBlk' should be the internal data itself, instead of a copy, in order to increase the data transfer efficiency. However, this depends on the particular implementation (it may be more convenient to just return a copy of the data). This is the reason why the returned data should not be modified.
If the data array in is null, then a new one is created if necessary. The implementation of this interface may choose to return the same array or a new one, depending on what is more efficient. Therefore, the data array in prior to the method call should not be considered to contain the returned data, a new array may have been created. Instead, get the array from after the method has returned.
The returned data may have its 'progressive' attribute set. In this case the returned data is only an approximation of the "final" data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return, relative to the current tile. Some fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data.

The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' of the returned data is 0, and the 'scanw' is the same as the block's width. See the 'DataBlk' class.
If the data array in 'blk' is 'null', then a new one is created. If the data array is not 'null' then it is reused, and it must be large enough to contain the block's data. Otherwise an 'ArrayStoreException' or an 'IndexOutOfBoundsException' is thrown by the Java system.
The returned data has its 'progressive' attribute set to that of the input data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return. If it contains a non-null data array, then it must have the correct dimensions. If it contains a null data array a new one is created. The fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data. Only 0 and 3 are valid.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.PalettizedColorSpaceMapper.getNomRangeBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of bits, referred to as the "range bits", corresponding to the nominal range of the image data in the specified component. If this number is n then for unsigned data the nominal range is between 0 and 2^b-1, and for signed data it is between -2^(b-1) and 2^(b-1)-1. In the case of transformed data which is not in the image domain (e.g., wavelet coefficients), this method returns the "range bits" of the image data that generated the coefficients.
member.returns: The number of bits corresponding to the nominal range of the image data (in the image domain).

member.param: The index of the component (between 0 and N-1)
member.returns: The horizontal subsampling factor of component 'c'

member.param: The index of the component (between 0 and N-1)
member.returns: The vertical subsampling factor of component 'c'

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.colorspace.Resampler.getInternCompData(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlk,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Return a DataBlk containing the requested component upsampled by the scale factor applied to the particular scaling direction
Returns, in the blk argument, a block of image data containing the specifed rectangular area, in the specified component. The data is returned, as a copy of the internal data, therefore the returned data can be modified "in place".
The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' of the returned data is 0, and the 'scanw' is the same as the block's width. See the 'DataBlk' class.
If the data array in 'blk' is 'null', then a new one is created. If the data array is not 'null' then it is reused, and it must be large enough to contain the block's data. Otherwise an Exception is thrown.
The returned data has its 'progressive' attribute set to that of the input data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return. If it contains a non-null data array, then it must have the correct dimensions. If it contains a null data array a new one is created. The fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data. Only 0 and 3 are valid.

member.summary: Return an appropriate String representation of this Resampler instance.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.ICCProfile
member.summary:
This class models the ICCProfile file. This file is a binary file which is divided into two parts, an ICCProfileHeader followed by an ICCTagTable. The header is a straightforward list of descriptive parameters such as profile size, version, date and various more esoteric parameters. The tag table is a structured list of more complexly aggragated data describing things such as ICC curves, copyright information, descriptive text blocks, etc.
Classes exist to model the header and tag table and their various constituent parts the developer is refered to these for further information on the structure and contents of the header and tag table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.ICCProfiler.getCompData(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlk,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns, in the blk argument, a block of image data containing the specified rectangular area, in the specified component. The data is returned, as a copy of the internal data, therefore the returned data can be modified "in place".
The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' of the returned data is 0, and the 'scanw' is the same as the block's width. See the 'DataBlk' class.
If the data array in 'blk' is 'null', then a new one is created. If the data array is not 'null' then it is reused, and it must be large enough to contain the block's data.
The returned data has its 'progressive' attribute set to that of the input data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return. If it contains a non-null data array, then it must have the correct dimensions. If it contains a null data array a new one is created. The fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data. Only 0 and 3 are valid.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.ICCProfiler.getInternCompData(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlk,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns, in the blk argument, a block of image data containing the specifed rectangular area, in the specified component. The data is returned, as a reference to the internal data, if any, instead of as a copy, therefore the returned data should not be modified.
The rectangular area to return is specified by the 'ulx', 'uly', 'w' and 'h' members of the 'blk' argument, relative to the current tile. These members are not modified by this method. The 'offset' and 'scanw' of the returned data can be arbitrary. See the 'DataBlk' class.
This method, in general, is more efficient than the 'getCompData()' method since it may not copy the data. However if the array of returned data is to be modified by the caller then the other method is probably preferable.
If possible, the data in the returned 'DataBlk' should be the internal data itself, instead of a copy, in order to increase the data transfer efficiency. However, this depends on the particular implementation (it may be more convenient to just return a copy of the data). This is the reason why the returned data should not be modified.
If the data array in is null, then a new one is created if necessary. The implementation of this interface may choose to return the same array or a new one, depending on what is more efficient. Therefore, the data array in prior to the method call should not be considered to contain the returned data, a new array may have been created. Instead, get the array from after the method has returned.
The returned data may have its 'progressive' attribute set. In this case the returned data is only an approximation of the "final" data.
member.param: Its coordinates and dimensions specify the area to return, relative to the current tile. Some fields in this object are modified to return the data.
The index of the component from which to get the data.

member.summary: Transform for applying ICCProfiling to an input DataBlk

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.lut.MatrixBasedTransformTosRGB.ToString
member.summary: String representation of class

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.lut.MatrixBasedTransformTosRGB.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.RestrictedICCProfile,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Construct a 3 component transform based on an input RestricedICCProfile This transform will pass the input throught a floating point lut (LookUpTableFP), apply a matrix to the output and finally pass the intermediate buffer through a 8-bit lut (LookUpTable8). This operation will be designated (LFP*M*L8) * Data The operators (LFP*M*L8) are constructed here. Although the data for only one component is returned, the transformation must be done for all components, because the matrix application involves a linear combination of component input to produce the output.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.lut.MatrixBasedTransformTosRGB.apply(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlkInt[],GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.DataBlkInt[])
member.summary: Performs the transform. Pass the input throught the LookUpTableFP, apply the matrix to the output and finally pass the intermediate buffer through the LookUpTable8. This operation is designated (LFP*M*L8) * Data are already constructed. Although the data for only one component is returned, the transformation must be done for all components, because the matrix application involves a linear combination of component input to produce the output.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.tags.ICCTag
member.summary: An ICC profile contains a 128-byte header followed by a variable number of tags contained in a tag table. Each tag is a structured block of ints. The tags share a common format on disk starting with a signature, an offset to the tag data, and a length of the tag data. The tag data itself is found at the given offset in the file and consists of a tag type int, followed by a reserved int, followed by a data block, the structure of which is unique to the tag type. This class is the abstract super class of all tags. It models that part of the structure which is common among tags of all types. It also contains the definitions of the various tag types.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.tags.ICCTagTable
member.summary:
This class models an ICCTagTable as a HashTable which maps ICCTag signatures (as Integers) to ICCTags.
On disk the tag table exists as a byte array conventionally aggragted into a structured sequence of types (bytes, shorts, ints, and floats. The first four bytes are the integer count of tags in the table. This is followed by an array of triplets, one for each tag. The triplets each contain three integers, which are the tag signature, the offset of the tag in the byte array and the length of the tag in bytes. The tag data follows. Each tag consists of an integer (4 bytes) tag type, a reserved integer and the tag data, which varies depending on the tag.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.icc.types.ICCProfileHeader
member.summary: An ICC profile contains a 128-byte header followed by a variable number of tags contained in a tag table. This class models the header portion of the profile. Most fields in the header are ints. Some, such as data and version are aggregations of ints. member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer
member.summary:
This class provides an ImageProducer for the IBlkImgDataSrc interface. It will request data from the IBlkImgDataSrc source and deliver it to the registered image consumers. The data is requested line by line, starting at the top of each tile. The tiles are requested in raster-scan order.
The image data is not rescaled to fit the available dynamic range (not even the alpha values for RGBA data).
IBlkImgDataSrc sources with 1, 3 and 4 components are supported. If 1, it is assumed to be gray-level data. If 3 it is assumed to be RGB data, in that order. If 4 it is assumed to be RGBA data (RGB plus alpha plane), in that order. All components must have the same size.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.consumers
member.summary: The list of image consumers for this image producer

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.src
member.summary: The source of image data

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.type
member.summary: The type of image: GRAY, RGB or RGBA

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.GRAY
member.summary: The gray-level image type (256 levels). For this type the source of image data must have only 1 component.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.RGB
member.summary: The color image type (24 bits RGB). No alpha plane. For this type the source of image data must have 3 components, which are considered to be R, G and B, in that order

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.RGBA
member.summary: The color image type (32 bits RGBA). For this type the source of image data must have 4 components, which are considered to be R, G, B and A, in that order.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.image.IBlkImgDataSrc)
member.summary: Creates an image producer which uses 'src' as the source of image data. If 'once' is true then the image is produced only once.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.addConsumer(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.util.IImageConsumer)
member.summary: Registers an image consumer with this image producer. The delivery of image data does not start immediately. It will only start after the next call to the startProduction() method.
member.param: The image consumer to which image data has to be delivered.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.isConsumer(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.util.IImageConsumer)
member.summary: This method determines if the given image consumer, 'ic', is registered with this image producer.
member.returns: True if 'ic' is registered with this image producer, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.removeConsumer(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.util.IImageConsumer)
member.summary: Removes the given image consumer 'ic' from the list of consumers registered with this producer. This image producer will stop sending pixel data to 'ic' as soon as it is feasible. The method call is ignored if 'ic' has not been registered with this image producer.
member.param: The image consumer to be removed

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.startProduction(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.util.IImageConsumer)
member.summary:
Registers the given IImageConsumer object as a consumer and starts an immediate reconstruction of the image data which will then be delivered to this consumer and any other consumer which may have already been registered with the producer.
Delivery is performed in "parallel" to all the registered image consumers. By "parallel" it is meant that each line of the image is delivered to all consumers before delivering the next line.
If the data returned by the IBlkImgDataSrc source happens to be progressive (see IBlkImgDataSrc and DataBlk) then the abort condition is sent to the image consumers and no further data is delivered.
Once all the data is sent to a consumer this one is automatically removed from the list of registered ones, unless an abort happens.
To start the IBlkImgDataSrc is set to tile (0,0), and the tiles are produced in raster scan order. Once the last tile is produced, setTile(0,0) is called again, which signals that we are done with the current tile, which might free up resources.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.disp.BlkImgDataSrcImageProducer.requestTopDownLeftRightResend(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.util.IImageConsumer)
member.summary:
Starts the delivery of pixel data in the top-down left-right order to the image consumer 'ic'. The TOPDOWNLEFTRIGHT hint is set in the image consumer on delivery.
Currently this call is ignored (which is perfectly legal according to the ImageProducer interface specification).
member.param: The image consumer to which the data is sent in top-down, left-right order.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.Markers
member.summary: This class defines the values of the different markers in the JPEG 2000 codestream. There are 16 bit values, always appearing in big-endian (most significant byte first) and byte-aligned in the codestream. This class also defines some other constants such as bit-masks and bit-shifts.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.ProgressionType
member.summary: This class defines the identifiers for the different codestream profiles and progression types.

remarks.para: Each progressive type has a different number: 'LY_RES_COMP_POS_PROG', 'RES_LY_COMP_POS_PROG', 'RES_POS_COMP_LY_PROG', 'POS_COMP_RES_LY_PROG' or 'COMP_POS_RES_LY_PROG'. These are the same identifiers are used in the codestream syntax.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.BitstreamReaderAgent
member.summary:
This is the generic interface for bit stream reader agents. A bit stream reader agent is an entity that allows reading from a bit stream and requesting compressed code-blocks. It can be a simple file reader, or a network connection, or anything else.
The bit stream reader agent allows to make request for compressed block data in any order. The amount of data returned would normally depend on the data available at the time of the request, be it from a file or from a network connection.
The bit stream reader agent has the notion of a current tile, and coordinates are relative to the current tile, where applicable.
Resolution level 0 is the lowest resolution level, i.e. the LL subband alone.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.BitstreamReaderAgent.getTileWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the overall width of the current tile in pixels for the given (tile) resolution level. This is the tile's width without accounting for any component subsampling.
Note: Tile resolution level indexes may be different from tile-component resolution index. They are indeed indexed starting from the lowest number of decomposition levels of each component of the tile.
For an image (1 tile) with 2 components (component 0 having 2 decomposition levels and component 1 having 3 decomposition levels), the first (tile-)component has 3 resolution levels and the second one has 4 resolution levels, whereas the tile has only 3 resolution levels available.
member.returns: The current tile's width in pixels.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.BitstreamReaderAgent.getTileHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the overall height of the current tile in pixels, for the given resolution level. This is the tile's height without accounting for any component subsampling.
Note: Tile resolution level indexes may be different from tile-component resolution index. They are indeed indexed starting from the lowest number of decomposition levels of each component of the tile.
For an image (1 tile) with 2 components (component 0 having 2 decomposition levels and component 1 having 3 decomposition levels), the first (tile-)component has 3 resolution levels and the second one has 4 resolution levels, whereas the tile has only 3 resolution levels available.
member.returns: The total current tile's height in pixels.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.BitstreamReaderAgent.getImgWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the overall width of the image in pixels, for the given (image) resolution level. This is the image's width without accounting for any component subsampling or tiling.
Note: Image resolution level indexes may differ from tile-component resolution index. They are indeed indexed starting from the lowest number of decomposition levels of each component of each tile.
Example: For an image (1 tile) with 2 components (component 0 having 2 decomposition levels and component 1 having 3 decomposition levels), the first (tile-) component has 3 resolution levels and the second one has 4 resolution levels, whereas the image has only 3 resolution levels available.
member.returns: The total image's width in pixels.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.BitstreamReaderAgent.getImgHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the overall height of the image in pixels, for the given resolution level. This is the image's height without accounting for any component subsampling or tiling.
Note: Image resolution level indexes may differ from tile-component resolution index. They are indeed indexed starting from the lowest number of decomposition levels of each component of each tile.
Example: For an image (1 tile) with 2 components (component 0 having 2 decomposition levels and component 1 having 3 decomposition levels), the first (tile-) component has 3 resolution levels and the second one has 4 resolution levels, whereas the image has only 3 resolution levels available.
member.param: The image resolution level, from 0 to L.
member.returns: The total image's height in pixels.

Note: Image resolution level indexes may differ from tile-component resolution index. They are indeed indexed starting from the lowest number of decomposition levels of each component of each tile.
Example: For an image (1 tile) with 2 components (component 0 having 2 decomposition levels and component 1 having 3 decomposition levels), the first (tile-) component has 3 resolution levels and the second one has 4 resolution levels, whereas the image has only 3 resolution levels available.
member.param: The resolution level, from 0 to L.
member.returns: The horizontal coordinate of the image origin in the canvas system, on the reference grid.

The first element is the option name, the second one is the synopsis and the third one is a long description of what the parameter is. The synopsis or description may be 'null', in which case it is assumed that there is no synopsis or description of the option, respectively. Null may be returned if no options are supported.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.FileBitstreamReaderAgent
member.summary:
This class reads the bit stream (with the help of HeaderDecoder for tile headers and PktDecoder for packets header and body) and retrives location of all code-block's codewords.
Note: All tile-parts headers are read by the constructor whereas packets are processed when decoding related tile (when setTile method is called).
In parsing mode, the reader simulates a virtual layer-resolution progressive bit stream with the same truncation points in each code-block, whereas in truncation mode, only the first bytes are taken into account (it behaves like if it is a real truncated codestream).

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.FileBitstreamReaderAgent.nextTile
member.summary: Advances to the next tile, in standard scan-line order (by rows then columns). An Exception is thrown if the current tile is the last one (i.e. there is no next tile).

Returns the specified coded code-block, for the specified component, in the current tile. The first layer to return is indicated by 'fl'. The number of layers that is returned depends on 'nl' and the amount of available data.
The argument 'fl' is to be used by subsequent calls to this method for the same code-block. In this way supplemental data can be retrieved at a later time. The fact that data from more than one layer can be returned means that several packets from the same code-block, of the same component, and the same tile, have been concatenated.
The returned compressed code-block can have its progressive attribute set. If this attribute is set it means that more data can be obtained by subsequent calls to this method (subject to transmission delays, etc). If the progressive attribute is not set it means that the returned data is all the data that can be obtained for the specified code-block.
The compressed code-block is uniquely specified by the current tile, the component (identified by 'c'), the subband (indentified by 'sb') and the code-block vertical and horizontal indexes 'n' and 'm'.
The 'ulx' and 'uly' members of the returned 'DecLyrdCBlk' object contain the coordinates of the top-left corner of the block, with respect to the tile, not the subband.
member.param: The index of the component, from 0 to N-1.
The vertical index of the code-block to return, in the specified subband.
The horizontal index of the code-block to return, in the specified subband.
The subband in whic the requested code-block is.
The number of layers to return, if negative all available layers are returned, starting at 'fl'.

If not null this object is used to return the compressed code-block. If null a new object is created and returned. If the data array in ccb is not null then it can be reused to return the compressed data.
member.returns: The compressed code-block, with a certain number of layers determined by the available data and 'nl'.

member.summary:
Synchronizes this object with the underlying byte based input. It discards and buffered bits and gets ready to read bits from the current position in the underlying byte based input.
This method should always be called when some data has been read directly from the underlying byte based input since the last call to 'readBits()' or 'readBit()' before a new call to any of those methods.

member.summary:
Sets the underlying byte based input to the given object. This method discards any currently buffered bits and gets ready to start reading bits from 'in'.
This method is equivalent to creating a new 'PktHeaderBitReader' object.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.TagTreeDecoder
member.summary:
This class implements the tag tree decoder. A tag tree codes a 2D matrix of integer elements in an efficient way. The decoding procedure 'update()' updates a value of the matrix from a stream of coded data, given a threshold. This procedure decodes enough information to identify whether or not the value is greater than or equal to the threshold, and updates the value accordingly.
In general the decoding procedure must follow the same sequence of elements and thresholds as the encoding one. The encoder is implemented by the TagTreeEncoder class.
Tag trees that have one dimension, or both, as 0 are allowed for convenience. Of course no values can be set or coded in such cases.

member.summary: The vertical dimensions of the base level

member.summary: The number of levels in the tag tree

member.summary: The tag tree values. The first index is the level, starting at level 0 (leafs). The second index is the element within the level, in lexicographical order.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.reader.TagTreeDecoder.treeS
member.summary: The tag tree state. The first index is the level, starting at level 0 (leafs). The second index is the element within the level, in lexicographical order.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.codestream.HeaderDecoder
member.summary: This class reads main and tile-part headers from the codestream given a instance located at the beginning of the codestream (i.e just before the SOC marker) or at the beginning of a tile-part (i.e. just before a SOT marker segment) respectively.

remarks.para: A marker segment includes a marker and eventually marker segment parameters. It is designed by the three letters code of the marker associated with the marker segment. JPEG 2000 part 1 defines 6 types of markers segments:
The main header is read when the constructor is called whereas tile-part headers are read when the FileBitstreamReaderAgent instance is created. The reading is done in 2 passes:
All marker segments are buffered and their corresponding flag is activated (extractMainMarkSeg and extractTilePartMarkSeg methods).
Buffered marker segment are analyzed in a logical way and specifications are stored in appropriate member of DecoderSpecs instance (readFoundMainMarkSeg and readFoundTilePartMarkSeg methods).
Whenever a marker segment is not recognized a warning message is displayed and its length parameter is used to skip it.
The information found in this header is stored in HeaderInfo and DecoderSpecs instances.
