member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SubbandSyn
member.summary:
This class represents a subband in a tree structure that describes the subband decomposition for a wavelet transform, specifically for the syhthesis side.
The element can be either a node or a leaf of the tree. If it is a node then ther are 4 descendants (LL, HL, LH and HH). If it is a leaf there are no descendants.
The tree is bidirectional. Each element in the tree structure has a "parent", which is the subband from which the element was obtained by decomposition. The only exception is the root element which has no parent (i.e.it's null), for obvious reasons.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilter
member.summary: This abstract class defines the methods of all synthesis wavelet filters. Specialized abstract classes that work on particular data types (int, float) provide more specific method calls while retaining the generality of this one. See the SynWTFilterInt and SynWTFilterFloat classes. Implementations of snythesis filters should inherit from one of those classes.
member.remarks:
The length of the output signal is always the sum of the length of the low-pass and high-pass input signals. All synthesis wavelet filters should follow the following conventions:
The first sample of the output corresponds to the low-pass one. As a consequence, if the output signal is of odd-length then the low-pass input signal is one sample longer than the high-pass input one. Therefore, if the length of output signal is N, the low-pass input signal is of length N/2 if N is even and N/2+1/2 if N is odd, while the high-pass input signal is of length N/2 if N is even and N/2-1/2 if N is odd.
The normalization of the analysis filters is 1 for the DC gain and 2 for the Nyquist gain (Type I normalization), for both reversible and non-reversible filters. The normalization of the synthesis filters should ensure prefect reconstruction according to this normalization of the analysis wavelet filters.
The synthetize method may seem very complicated, but is designed to minimize the amount of data copying and redundant calculations when used for block-based or line-based wavelet transform implementations, while being applicable to full-frame transforms as well.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilter.synthetize_lpf(System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reconstructs the output signal by the synthesis filter, recomposing the low-pass and high-pass input signals in one output signal. This method performs the upsampling and filtering with the low pass first filtering convention.

remarks.para: The input low-pass (high-pass) signal resides in the lowSig array. The index of the first sample to filter (i.e. that will generate the first (second) output sample). is given by lowOff (highOff). This array must be of the same type as the one for which the particular implementation works with (which is returned by the getDataType() method).

The low-pass (high-pass) input signal can be interleaved with other signals in the same lowSig (highSig) array, and this is determined by the lowStep (highStep) argument. This means that the first sample of the low-pass (high-pass) input signal is lowSig[lowOff] (highSig[highOff]), the second is lowSig[lowOff+lowStep] (highSig[highOff+highStep]), the third is lowSig[lowOff+2*lowStep] (highSig[highOff+2*highStep]), and so on. Therefore if lowStep (highStep) is 1 there is no interleaving. This feature allows to filter columns of a 2-D signal, when it is stored in a line by line order in lowSig (highSig), without having to copy the data, in this case the lowStep (highStep) argument should be the line width of the low-pass (high-pass) signal.

The output signal is placed in the outSig array. The outOff and outStep arguments are analogous to the lowOff and lowStep ones, but they apply to the outSig array. The outSig array must be long enough to hold the low-pass output signal.

member.param: This is the array that contains the low-pass input signal. It must be of the correct type (e.g., it must be int[] if getDataType() returns TYPE_INT).
This is the index in lowSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the low-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the low-pass input signal samples in the lowSig array. See above.
This is the array that contains the high-pass input signal. It must be of the correct type (e.g., it must be int[] if getDataType() returns TYPE_INT).
This is the index in highSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the high-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the high-pass input signal samples in the highSig array. See above.
This is the array where the output signal is placed. It must be of the same type as lowSig and it should be long enough to contain the output signal.
This is the index in outSig of the element where to put the first output sample.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the output samples in the outSig array. See above.

The low-pass (high-pass) input signal can be interleaved with other signals in the same lowSig (highSig) array, and this is determined by the lowStep (highStep) argument. Therefore if lowStep (highStep) is 1 there is no interleaving. This feature allows to filter columns of a 2-D signal, when it is stored in a line by line order in lowSig (highSig), without having to copy the data, in this case the lowStep (highStep) argument should be the line width of the low-pass (high-pass) signal.

The output signal is placed in the outSig array. The outOff and outStep arguments are analogous to the lowOff and lowStep ones, but they apply to the outSig array. The outSig array must be long enough to hold the low-pass output signal.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterFloat
member.summary:
This extends the synthesis wavelet filter general definitions of SynWTFilter by adding methods that work for float data specifically. Implementations that work on float data should inherit from this class.
See the SynWTFilter class for details such as normalization, how to split odd-length signals, etc.
The advantage of using the specialized method is that no casts are performed.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterFloatLift9x7
member.summary:
This class inherits from the synthesis wavelet filter definition for int data. It implements the inverse wavelet transform specifically for the 9x7 filter. The implementation is based on the lifting scheme.
See the SynWTFilter class for details such as normalization, how to split odd-length signals, etc. In particular, this method assumes that the low-pass coefficient is computed first.

member.summary: The value of the first lifting step coefficient

member.summary: The value of the second lifting step coefficient

member.summary: The value of the third lifting step coefficient

member.summary: The value of the low-pass subband normalization factor

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterFloatLift9x7.synthetize_lpf(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
An implementation of the synthetize_lpf() method that works on int data, for the inverse 9x7 wavelet transform using the lifting scheme. See the general description of the synthetize_lpf() method in the SynWTFilter class for more details.
The low-pass and high-pass subbands are normalized by respectively a factor of 1/KL and a factor of 1/KH
The coefficients of the first lifting step are [-DELTA 1 -DELTA].
The coefficients of the second lifting step are [-GAMMA 1 -GAMMA].
The coefficients of the third lifting step are [-BETA 1 -BETA].
The coefficients of the fourth lifting step are [-ALPHA 1 -ALPHA].
member.param: This is the array that contains the low-pass input signal.
This is the index in lowSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the low-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the low-pass input signal samples in the lowSig array.
This is the array that contains the high-pass input signal.
This is the index in highSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the high-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the high-pass input signal samples in the highSig array.
This is the array where the output signal is placed. It should be long enough to contain the output signal.
This is the index in outSig of the element where to put the first output sample.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the output samples in the outSig array.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterFloatLift9x7.isSameAsFullWT(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns true if the wavelet filter computes or uses the same "inner" subband coefficient as the full frame wavelet transform, and false otherwise. In particular, for block based transforms with reduced overlap, this method should return false. The term "inner" indicates that this applies only with respect to the coefficient that are not affected by image boundaries processings such as symmetric extension, since there is not reference method for this.
The result depends on the length of the allowed overlap when compared to the overlap required by the wavelet filter. It also depends on how overlap processing is implemented in the wavelet filter.
member.param: This is the number of samples in the input signal before the first sample to filter that can be used for overlap.
This is the number of samples in the input signal after the last sample to filter that can be used for overlap.
This is the lenght of the input signal to filter.The required number of samples in the input signal after the last sample depends on the length of the input signal.
member.returns: true if both overlaps are greater than 2, and correct processing is applied in the analyze() method.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterFloatLift9x7.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string of information about the synthesis wavelet filter

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterInt
member.summary:
This extends the synthesis wavelet filter general definitions of SynWTFilter by adding methods that work for int data specifically. Implementations that work on int data should inherit from this class.
See the SynWTFilter class for details such as normalization, how to split odd-length signals, etc.
The advantage of using the specialized method is that no casts are performed.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterInt.synthetize_lpf(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A specific version of the synthetize_lpf() method that works on int data. See the general description of the synthetize_lpf() method in the SynWTFilter class for more details.
member.param: This is the array that contains the low-pass input signal.
This is the index in lowSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the low-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the low-pass input signal samples in the lowSig array.
This is the array that contains the high-pass input signal.
This is the index in highSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the high-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the high-pass input signal samples in the highSig array.
This is the array where the output signal is placed. It should be long enough to contain the output signal.
This is the index in outSig of the element where to put the first output sample.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the output samples in the outSig array.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterIntLift5x3
member.summary:
This class inherits from the synthesis wavelet filter definition for int data. It implements the inverse wavelet transform specifically for the 5x3 filter. The implementation is based on the lifting scheme.
See the SynWTFilter class for details such as normalization, how to split odd-length signals, etc. In particular, this method assumes that the low-pass coefficient is computed first.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterIntLift5x3.synthetize_lpf(System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
An implementation of the synthetize_lpf() method that works on int data, for the inverse 5x3 wavelet transform using the lifting scheme. See the general description of the synthetize_lpf() method in the SynWTFilter class for more details.
The coefficients of the first lifting step are [-1/4 1 -1/4].
The coefficients of the second lifting step are [1/2 1 1/2].
member.param: This is the array that contains the low-pass input signal.
This is the index in lowSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the low-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the low-pass input signal samples in the lowSig array.
This is the array that contains the high-pass input signal.
This is the index in highSig of the first sample to filter.
This is the number of samples in the high-pass input signal to filter.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the high-pass input signal samples in the highSig array.
This is the array where the output signal is placed. It should be long enough to contain the output signal.
This is the index in outSig of the element where to put the first output sample.
This is the step, or interleave factor, of the output samples in the outSig array.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterSpec.getHFilters(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the horizontal analysis filters to be used in component 'n' and tile 't'.
member.remarks: The horizontal analysis filters are returned in an array of . Each element contains the horizontal filter for each resolution level starting with resolution level 1 (i.e. the analysis filter to go from resolution level 1 to resolution level 0). If there are less elements than the maximum resolution level, then the last element is assumed to be repeated.
member.param: The tile index, in raster scan order
member.returns: The array of horizontal analysis filters for component 'n' and tile 't'.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.jpeg.jj2000.j2k.wavelet.synthesis.SynWTFilterSpec.getVFilters(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the vertical analysis filters to be used in component 'n' and tile 't'.
member.remarks: The vertical analysis filters are returned in an array of . Each element contains the vertical filter for each resolution level starting with resolution level 1 (i.e. the analysis filter to go from resolution level 1 to resolution level 0). If there are less elements than the maximum resolution level, then the last element is assumed to be repeated.
member.param: The tile index, in raster scan order
member.returns: The array of horizontal analysis filters for component 'n' and tile 't'.

member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used for chromatic adaptation in conversions from/to XYZ color space. When default, no adaptation will be performed. Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetLuvWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Luv/LChuv colors. (Luv/LChuv colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Lab/LChab colors. (Lab/LChab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetHunterLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* HunterLab colors. (HunterLab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.TargetRgbWorkingSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the target working space used *when creating* RGB colors. (RGB colors on the input already contain the working space information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Gets or sets the chromatic adaptation method used. When null, no adaptation will be performed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverterOptions.LmsAdaptationMatrix

member.summary: Enumerates the available bits per pixel the bitmap encoder supports.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel8
member.summary: 8 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 1 byte.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel16
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 2 bytes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel24
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 3 bytes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 4 bytes.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression
member.summary: Defines the compression type of the image data in the bitmap file.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RGB
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. The format depends on the number of bits, stored in the info header. If the number of bits are one, four or eight each pixel data is a index to the palette. If the number of bits are sixteen, twenty-four or thirty-two each pixel contains a color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE8
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next byte will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE4
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next two half bytes will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.BitFields
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.JPEG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a JPG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.PNG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a PNG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.BI_ALPHABITFIELDS
member.summary: Introduced with Windows CE. Specifies that the bitmap is not compressed and that the color table consists of four DWORD color masks that specify the red, green, blue, and alpha components of each pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE24
member.summary:
OS/2 specific compression type. Similar to run length encoding of 4 and 8 bit. The only difference is that run values encoded are three bytes in size (one byte per RGB color component), rather than four or eight bits in size.
Note: Because compression value of 4 is ambiguous for BI_RGB for windows and RLE24 for OS/2, the enum value is remapped to a different value, to be clearly separate from valid windows values.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoder
member.summary: Image decoder for generating an image out of a Windows bitmap stream.
member.remarks:
Does not support the following formats at the moment:
JPG
PNG
Some OS/2 specific subtypes like: Bitmap Array, Color Icon, Color Pointer, Icon, Pointer.
Formats will be supported in a later releases. We advise always to use only 24 Bit Windows bitmaps.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle4(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE4 stream.
member.remarks:
RLE4 is a 2-byte run-length encoding.
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and second byte contains two color indexes.
member.param: Keeps track over skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle8(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE8 stream.
member.remarks:
RLE8 is a 2-byte run-length encoding.
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and second byte is the color for the run.
member.param: Keeps track of skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoderCore.UncompressRle24(System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Boolean},System.Span{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Produce uncompressed bitmap data from a RLE24 stream.
member.remarks:
If first byte is 0, the second byte may have special meaning.
Otherwise, the first byte is the length of the run and following three bytes are the color for the run.
member.param: Keeps track of skipped and therefore undefined pixels.
Keeps track of rows, which have undefined pixels.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the encoder should support transparency. Note: Transparency support only works together with 32 bits per pixel. This option will change the default behavior of the encoder of writing a bitmap version 3 info header with no compression. Instead a bitmap version 4 info header will be written with the BITFIELDS compression.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Block8x8F.DequantizeBlock(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Block8x8F*,GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Block8x8F*,System.Byte*)
member.summary: Quantize the block.

Quantize 'block' into 'dest' using the 'qt' quantization table: Unzig the elements of block into dest, while dividing them by elements of qt and "pre-rounding" the values. To finish the rounding it's enough to (int)-cast these values.

member.summary: Represents a Huffman coding table containing basic coding data plus tables for accelerated computation.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.Sizes
member.summary: Derived from the DHT marker. Sizes[k] = # of symbols with codes of length k bits; Sizes[0] is unused.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.Values
member.summary: Derived from the DHT marker. Contains the symbols, in order of incremental code length.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.MaxCode
member.summary: Contains the largest code of length k (0 if none). MaxCode[17] is a sentinel to ensure terminates.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.ValOffset
member.summary: Values[] offset for codes of length k ValOffset[k] = Values[] index of 1st symbol of code length k, less the smallest code of length k; so given a code of length k, the corresponding symbol is Values[code + ValOffset[k]].

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.LookaheadSize
member.summary: Contains the length of bits for the given k value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.HuffmanTable.LookaheadValue
member.summary:
Lookahead table: indexed by the next bits of the input data stream. If the next Huffman code is no more than bits long, we can obtain its length and the corresponding symbol directly from this tables.
The lower 8 bits of each table entry contain the number of bits in the corresponding Huffman code, or + 1 if too long. The next 8 bits of each entry contain the symbol.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.JpegImagePostProcessor
member.summary:
Encapsulates the execution od post-processing algorithms to be applied on a to produce a valid :
(1) Dequantization
(2) IDCT
(3) Color conversion form one of the -s into a buffer of RGBA values
(4) Packing pixels from the buffer.
These operations are executed in steps. image rows are converted in one step, which means that size of the allocated memory is limited (does not depend on ).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag
member.summary: Holds the Jpeg UnZig array in a value/stack type. Unzig maps from the zigzag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zigzag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.Size
member.summary: When reading corrupted data, the Huffman decoders could attempt to reference an entry beyond the end of this array (if the decoded zero run length reaches past the end of the block). To prevent wild stores without adding an inner-loop test, we put some extra "63"s after the real entries. This will cause the extra coefficient to be stored in location 63 of the block, not somewhere random. The worst case would be a run-length of 15, which means we need 16 fake entries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.Data
member.summary: Copy of in a value type

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag.Unzig
member.summary: Gets the unzigs map, which maps from the zigzag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zigzag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.COM
member.summary: The text comment marker

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s) marker
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks.This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegEncoderCore.SosHeaderYCbCr
member.summary: Gets the SOS (Start Of Scan) marker "\xff\xda" followed by 12 bytes: - the marker length "\x00\x0c", - the number of components "\x03", - component 1 uses DC table 0 and AC table 0 "\x01\x00", - component 2 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x02\x11", - component 3 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x03\x11", - the bytes "\x00\x3f\x00". Section B.2.3 of the spec says that for sequential DCTs, those bytes (8-bit Ss, 8-bit Se, 4-bit Ah, 4-bit Al) should be 0x00, 0x3f, 0x00<<4 | 0x00.

member.summary: Gets the unscaled quantization tables in zig-zag order. Each encoder copies and scales the tables according to its quality parameter. The values are derived from section K.1 after converting from natural to zig-zag order.

member.summary: Provides enumeration of the various PNG filter types.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified; it is only necessary to insert a filter type byte before the data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the Sub filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Filters.FilterType.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value. This technique is due to Alan W. Paeth

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Filters.NoneFilter
member.summary: The None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified; it is only necessary to insert a filter type byte before the data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit1
member.summary: 1 bit per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit2
member.summary: 2 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit4
member.summary: 4 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit8
member.summary: 8 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngBitDepth.Bit16
member.summary: 16 bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk
member.summary: Stores header information about a chunk.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Length
member.summary: Gets the length. An unsigned integer giving the number of bytes in the chunk's data field. The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Type
member.summary: Gets the chunk type. The value is the equal to the UInt32BigEndian encoding of its 4 ASCII characters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Data
member.summary: Gets the data bytes appropriate to the chunk type, if any. This field can be of zero length or null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.IsCritical
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the given chunk is critical to decoding

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG optimization methods.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.None
member.summary: With the None filter, all chunks will be written.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludePhysicalChunk
member.summary: Excludes the physical dimension information chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeGammaChunk
member.summary: Excludes the gamma information chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeExifChunk
member.summary: Excludes the eXIf chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeTextChunks
member.summary: Excludes the tTXt, iTXt or zTXt chunk from encoding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkFilter.ExcludeAll
member.summary: All ancillary chunks will be excluded.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType
member.summary: Contains a list of chunk types.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG data stream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Exif
member.summary: The eXIf data chunk which contains the Exif profile.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Gamma
member.summary: This chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Physical
member.summary: The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.CompressedText
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image. The zTXt and tEXt chunks are semantically equivalent, but the zTXt chunk is recommended for storing large blocks of text. Each zTXt chunk contains a (uncompressed) keyword and a compressed text string.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.InternationalText
member.summary: The iTXt chunk contains International textual data. It contains a keyword, an optional language tag, an optional translated keyword and the actual text string, which can be compressed or uncompressed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Transparency
member.summary: The tRNS chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and true color images).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Time
member.summary: The tIME chunk gives the time of the last image modification (not the time of initial image creation).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Background
member.summary: The bKGD chunk specifies a default background colour to present the image against. If there is any other preferred background, either user-specified or part of a larger page (as in a browser), the bKGD chunk should be ignored.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.EmbeddedColorProfile
member.summary: The iCCP chunk contains a embedded color profile. If the iCCP chunk is present, the image samples conform to the colour space represented by the embedded ICC profile as defined by the International Color Consortium.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.SignificantBits
member.summary: The sBIT chunk defines the original number of significant bits (which can be less than or equal to the sample depth). This allows PNG decoders to recover the original data losslessly even if the data had a sample depth not directly supported by PNG.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.StandardRgbColourSpace
member.summary: If the sRGB chunk is present, the image samples conform to the sRGB colour space [IEC 61966-2-1] and should be displayed using the specified rendering intent defined by the International Color Consortium.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Histogram
member.summary: The hIST chunk gives the approximate usage frequency of each colour in the palette.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.SuggestedPalette
member.summary: The sPLT chunk contains the suggested palette.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Chroma
member.summary: The cHRM chunk may be used to specify the 1931 CIE x,y chromaticities of the red, green, and blue display primaries used in the image, and the referenced white point.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.ProprietaryApple
member.summary: Malformed chunk named CgBI produced by apple, which is not conform to the specification. Related issue is here https://github.com/SixLabors/ImageSharp/issues/410

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngColorType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG color types.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Grayscale
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Rgb
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Palette
member.summary: Each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk must appear.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngColorType.GrayscaleWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngColorType.RgbWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG filter methods.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFilterMethod.Adaptive
member.summary: Computes the output scanline using all five filters, and selects the filter that gives the smallest sum of absolute values of outputs. This method usually outperforms any single fixed filter choice.

member.summary: Registers the image encoders, decoders and mime type detectors for the png format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngFormat.Instance
member.summary: Gets the current instance.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader
member.summary: Represents the png header chunk.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets the dimension in x-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets the dimension in y-direction of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.BitDepth
member.summary: Gets the bit depth. Bit depth is a single-byte integer giving the number of bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel). Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16, although not all values are allowed for all color types.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.ColorType
member.summary: Gets the color type. Color type is a integer that describes the interpretation of the image data. Color type codes represent sums of the following values: 1 (palette used), 2 (color used), and 4 (alpha channel used).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Gets the compression method. Indicates the method used to compress the image data. At present, only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression with a sliding window of at most 32768 bytes) is defined.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.FilterMethod
member.summary: Gets the preprocessing method. Indicates the preprocessing method applied to the image data before compression. At present, only filter method 0 (adaptive filtering with five basic filter types) is defined.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.InterlaceMethod
member.summary: Gets the transmission order. Indicates the transmission order of the image data. Two values are currently defined: 0 (no interlace) or 1 (Adam7 interlace).

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngHeader.Validate
member.summary: Validates the png header.
member.exception: Thrown if the image does pass validation.

member.summary: Writes the header to the given buffer.

member.summary: Parses the PngHeader from the given data buffer.

member.summary: Gets or sets the 16 bit grayscale transparent color. This represents any color in a 16 bit grayscale encoded png that should be transparent.

member.summary: Provides methods to allow the decoding of raw scanlines to image rows of different pixel formats. TODO: We should make this a stateful class or struct to reduce the number of arguments on methods (most are invariant).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngTextData
member.summary: Stores text data contained in the iTXt, tEXt, and zTXt chunks. Used for conveying textual information associated with the image, like the name of the author, the copyright information, the date, where the image was created, or some other information.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.summary: Gets the keyword of this which indicates the type of information represented by the text string as described in https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#11keywords.
member.example: Typical properties are the author, copyright information or other meta information.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngTextData.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of this .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngTextData.LanguageTag
member.summary: Gets an optional language tag defined in https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#2-RFC-3066 indicates the human language used by the translated keyword and the text. If the first word is two or three letters long, it is an ISO language code https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/#2-ISO-639.
member.example: Examples: cn, en-uk, no-bok, x-klingon, x-KlInGoN.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngTextData.TranslatedKeyword
member.summary: Gets an optional translated keyword, should contain a translation of the keyword into the language indicated by the language tag.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater
member.summary: This class compresses input with the deflate algorithm described in RFC 1951. It has several compression levels and three different strategies described below.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.BestCompression
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.BestSpeed
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.DefaultCompression
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.NoCompression
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.Deflated
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.level
member.summary: Compression level.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.state
member.summary: The current state.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The memory allocator to use for buffer allocations.
The compression level, a value between NoCompression and BestCompression.
member.exception: if level is out of range.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Compression Level as an enum for safer use

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.BestCompression
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.BestSpeed
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.DefaultCompression
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.NoCompression
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.CompressionLevel.Deflated
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whetherthe stream was finished and no more output bytes are available.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method can also return true when the stream was finished.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.Reset
member.summary: Resets the deflater. The deflater acts afterwards as if it was just created with the same compression level and strategy as it had before.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current input block. Further calls to Deflate() will produce enough output to inflate everything in the current input block. It is used by DeflaterOutputStream to implement Flush().

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the deflater with the current input block. It is an error to give more input after this method was called. This method must be called to force all bytes to be flushed.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again.
member.param: The buffer containing the input data.
The number of data bytes of input.
member.exception: if the buffer was finished or if previous input is still pending.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.SetLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the compression level. There is no guarantee of the exact position of the change, but if you call this when needsInput is true the change of compression level will occur somewhere near before the end of the so far given input.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deflates the current input block to the given array.
member.param: Buffer to store the compressed data.
The maximum number of bytes that may be stored.
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either or returns true or length is zero.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflateStrategy
member.summary: Strategies for deflater

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflateStrategy.Default
member.summary: The default strategy

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflateStrategy.Filtered
member.summary: This strategy will only allow longer string repetitions. It is useful for random data with a small character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflateStrategy.HuffmanOnly
member.summary: This strategy will not look for string repetitions at all. It only encodes with Huffman trees (which means, that more common characters get a smaller encoding.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine
member.summary: Low level compression engine for deflate algorithm which uses a 32K sliding window with secondary compression from Huffman/Shannon-Fano codes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.strstart
member.summary: Points to the current character in the window.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.lookahead
member.summary: lookahead is the number of characters starting at strstart in window that are valid. So window[strstart] until window[strstart+lookahead-1] are valid characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.compressionFunction
member.summary: The current compression function.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.inputBuf
member.summary: The input data for compression.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.inputOff
member.summary: The offset into inputBuf, where input data starts.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.inputEnd
member.summary: The end offset of the input data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.headMemoryOwner
member.summary: Hashtable, hashing three characters to an index for window, so that window[index]..window[index+2] have this hash code. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xFFFF.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.prevMemoryOwner
member.summary: prev[index & WMASK] points to the previous index that has the same hash code as the string starting at index. This way entries with the same hash code are in a linked list. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xFFFF.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.DeflaterEngine.windowMemoryOwner
member.summary: This array contains the part of the uncompressed stream that is of relevance. The current character is indexed by strstart.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Image.WrapMemory``1(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Configuration,System.Memory{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Metadata.ImageMetadata)

summary.para: Wraps an existing contiguous memory area of at least 'width' x 'height' pixels allowing viewing/manipulation as an instance.

Please note: using this method does not transfer the ownership of the underlying buffer of the input to the new instance. This means that consumers of this method must ensure that the input buffer is either self-contained, (for example, a instance wrapping a new array that was created), or that the owning object is not disposed until the returned is disposed.

If the input instance is one retrieved from an instance rented from a memory pool (such as ), and that owning instance is disposed while the image is still in use, this will lead to undefined behavior and possibly runtime crashes (as the same buffer might then be modified by other consumers while the returned image is still working on it). Make sure to control the lifetime of the input buffers appropriately.

member.param: The width of the memory image.
The height of the memory image.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Image.WrapMemory``1(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Configuration,System.Void*,System.Int32,System.Int32,GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Metadata.ImageMetadata)

summary.para: Wraps an existing contiguous memory area of at least 'width' x 'height' pixels allowing viewing/manipulation as an instance.

Please note: this method relies on callers to carefully manage the target memory area being referenced by the pointer and that the lifetime of such a memory area is at least equal to that of the returned instance. For example, if the input pointer references an unmanaged memory area, callers must ensure that the memory area is not freed as long as the returned is in use and not disposed. The same applies if the input memory area points to a pinned managed object, as callers must ensure that objects will remain pinned as long as the instance is in use. Failing to do so constitutes undefined behavior and will likely lead to memory corruption and runtime crashes.

Note also that if you have a or an array (which can be cast to ) of either or values, it is highly recommended to use one of the other available overloads of this method instead (such as or , to make the resulting code less error prone and avoid having to pin the underlying memory buffer in use. This method is primarily meant to be used when doing interop or working with buffers that are located in unmanaged memory.

member.param: The pointer to the target memory buffer to wrap.
The width of the memory image.
The height of the memory image.

member.summary: The text comment marker

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s) marker
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks.This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.summary: Indicates that the pixel format does not contain an alpha channel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelAlphaRepresentation.Associated
member.summary: Indicates that the transparency behavior is premultiplied. Each color is first scaled by the alpha value. The alpha value itself is the same in both straight and premultiplied alpha. Typically, no color channel value is greater than the alpha channel value. If a color channel value in a premultiplied format is greater than the alpha channel, the standard source-over blending math results in an additive blend.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelAlphaRepresentation.Unassociated
member.summary: Indicates that the transparency behavior is not premultiplied. The alpha channel indicates the transparency of the color.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.DefaultPixelBlenders`1
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff alpha blending functions applying different composition models.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff Color Blending and Alpha Composition Functions.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.param: A value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of the second source vector. At amount = 0, "background" is returned, at amount = 1, "source" is returned.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode
member.summary: Enumerates the various color blending modes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Normal
member.summary: Default blending mode, also known as "Normal" or "Alpha Blending"

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Multiply
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by multiplication.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Add
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by addition.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Subtract
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by subtraction.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the minimum of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the max of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the values, depending on the backdrop vector values.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelColorBlendingMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source value.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelConversionModifiers
member.summary:
Flags responsible to select additional operations which could be efficiently applied in
or
knowing the pixel type.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelConversionModifiers.None
member.summary: No special operation is selected

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelConversionModifiers.Scale

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelConversionModifiers.Premultiply
member.summary: Enable alpha premultiplication / unpremultiplication

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelConversionModifiers.SRgbCompand
member.summary: Enable SRGB companding (defined in ).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.A8
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing a single 8-bit normalized alpha value.
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [0, 0, 0, 1] in vector form.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.Argb32
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in alpha, red, green, and blue order (least significant to most significant byte).
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.Rgba32
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order (least significant to most significant byte).
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer`1
member.summary: An implementation of Wu's color quantizer with alpha channel.

remarks.para: Based on C Implementation of Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer (v. 2) (see Graphics Gems volume II, pages 126-133) ().
This adaptation is based on the excellent JeremyAnsel.ColorQuant by Jrmy Ansel

Algorithm: Greedy orthogonal bipartition of RGB space for variance minimization aided by inclusion-exclusion tricks. For speed no nearest neighbor search is done. Slightly better performance can be expected by more sophisticated but more expensive versions.

member.summary: Gets the index of the given color in the palette.
Computes sum over a box of any given statistic.
Computes part of Volume(cube, moment) that doesn't depend on RMax, GMax, BMax, or AMax (depending on direction).
Computes remainder of Volume(cube, moment), substituting position for RMax, GMax, BMax, or AMax (depending on direction).

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer`1.Build3DHistogram(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Memory.Buffer2D{`0},GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ImgRectangle)
member.summary: Builds a 3-D color histogram of counts, r/g/b, c^2.
member.param: The bounds within the source image to quantize.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer`1.Get3DMoments(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Memory.MemoryAllocator)
member.summary: Converts the histogram into moments so that we can rapidly calculate the sums of the above quantities over any desired box.
member.param: The memory allocator used for allocating buffers.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer`1.Variance(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuQuantizer{`0}.Box@)
member.summary: Computes the weighted variance of a box cube.

We want to minimize the sum of the variances of two sub-boxes. The sum(c^2) terms can be ignored since their sum over both sub-boxes is the same (the sum for the whole box) no matter where we split. The remaining terms have a minus sign in the variance formula, so we drop the minus sign and maximize the sum of the two terms.

member.summary: Cuts a box.
member.returns: Returns a value indicating whether the box has been split.

member.summary:

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.BitsPerRedChannel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of bits per Red component of RGB color data (8 by default).
Applicable to RGB(A) images only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.BitsPerGreenChannel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of bits per Green component of RGB color data (8 by default).
Applicable to RGB(A) images only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.BitsPerBlueChannel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of bits per Blue component of RGB color data (8 by default).
Applicable to RGB(A) images only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.BitsPerAlphaChannel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of bits per Alpha component of RGBA color data (8 by default).
Applicable to RGBA images only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.BitsPerGrayscale
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of bits per Grayscale image color (8 by default).
Applicable to Grayscale images only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.Differencing
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating if the pixel values are replaced by differences between consecutive pixels.
Applicable to LZW and Deflate compression methods, ignored otherwise.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.LowerBitsFirst
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pixels are arranged within a byte such that pixels with lower column values are stored in the lower-order bits of the byte.
Applicable to bilevel images only.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffFrameSettings.Planar
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the color components are stored in separate "component planes."
Applicable to RGB images only.

member.summary: Various methods working with bitmap data.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.U.ClipToInterval(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Excludes areas outside the specified scan line interval.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.U.GetRegionUnion(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the union of two regions (as a scan line) in the destRegXs.
destRegXs must have space for (count1 + count2) elements.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.U.GetRegionIntersection(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the intersection of two regions (as a scan line) in the destRegXs.
destRegXs must have space for max(count1, count2) elements.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.U.GetRegionDifference(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the difference of two regions (as a scan line) in the destRegXs.
destRegXs must have space for (count1 + count2) elements.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.U.GetRegionXor(System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns the logical XOR of two regions (as a scan line) in the destRegXs.
destRegXs must have space for (count1 + count2) elements.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.GcGraphicsFeatures.SupportsBlendMode

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode
member.summary: Defines methods of mixing source and destination colors when drawing.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: No blending takes place. The source color replaces the destination color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary:
The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.
The resultant color is always at least as dark as either the source or destination color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary:
Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.
The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.
Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary:
Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.
The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary:
Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.
The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary:
Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary:
Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.
The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary:
Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.
The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary:
Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.
Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary:
Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.
Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary:
Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.
Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Color
member.summary:
Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.
This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary:
Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.
This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.GcGraphics.PushClip(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary:
Specifies a rectangle to which all subsequent drawing operations are clipped. Clipping is applied only if does not contain .
The object returned by this method implements IDisposable, so this method can be used with the 'using' pattern:
using (g.PushClip(...)) ...
in which case the clipping region will be removed when the returned object is disposed.
member.returns: The object that removes the clipping when disposed.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.GcGraphics.PushClip(System.Nullable{System.Drawing.RectangleF})
member.summary:
Specifies a rectangle to which all subsequent drawing operations are clipped.
The object returned by this method implements IDisposable, so this method can be used with the 'using' pattern:
using (g.PushClip(...)) ...
in which case the clipping region will be removed when the returned object is disposed.
member.param: The clipping rectangle. If this parameter is null, this method does nothing and returns null.
member.returns: The object that removes the clipping when disposed, or null.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Drawing.GcGraphics.PushClip(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
